DataElement.preferredName: Person Cerebrovascular Accident Transient Ischemic Attack Post Clinical Tial Eligibility Criteria Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether a person has had a cerebrovascular accident, a disorder characterized by a sudden loss of sensory function due to an intracranial vascular even, or transient ischemic attack, a brief attack (from a few minutes to an hour) of cerebral dysfunction of vascular origin, with no persistent neurological deficit, following administration of the study therapy as an element of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Cerebrovascular Accident Transient Ischemic Attack Post Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a person having had a cerebrovascular accident, a disorder characterized by a sudden loss of sensory function due to an intracranial vascular even, or transient ischemic attack, a brief attack (from a few minutes to an hour) of cerebral dysfunction of vascular origin, with no persistent neurological deficit, following administration of the study therapy as an element of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Property.preferredName: Cerebrovascular Accident Transient Ischemic Attack Post Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: A sudden, nonconvulsive loss of neurologic function due to an ischemic or hemorrhagic intracranial vascular event. In general, cerebrovascular accidents are classified by anatomic location in the brain, vascular distribution, etiology, age of the affected individual, and hemorrhagic vs. nonhemorrhagic nature. (From Adams et al., Principles of Neurology, 6th ed, pp777-810):A brief attack (from a few minutes to an hour) of cerebral dysfunction of vascular origin, with no persistent neurological deficit.:Post; occuring after.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: A sudden loss of neurological function secondary to hemorrhage or ischemia in the brain parenchyma due to a vascular event.
A brief attack (from a few minutes to an hour) of cerebral dysfunction of vascular origin, with no persistent neurological deficit.
Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of cerebrovascular accident (CVA, stroke), transient ischemic attack (TIA) or subarachnoid hemorrhage within six months of the first date of study therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does she have a history of ce
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does she have a history of cerebrovascular accident (CVA, stroke), transient ischemic attack (TIA) or subarachnoid hemorrhage within 6 months of starting pazopanib?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of cerebrovascular accident (CVA, stroke), transient ischemic attack (TIA) or subarachnoid hemorrhage within six months prior to the first date of therapy on this protocol?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of cerebrovascular accident (CVA, stroke), transient ischemic attack (TIA) or subarachnoid hemorrhage within six months of the first date of Bevacizumab therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of cerebrovascular accident (CVA, stroke), transient ischemic attack (TIA) or subarachnoid hemorrhage within six months of the first date of treatment on this study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: eligibily
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of cerebrovascular accident (CVA, stroke) or transient ischemic attack (TIA) within six months of study entry?
